Pre-Game Insights: Matthew Boyd will face his former team, the Detroit Tigers, in a win-or-go-home American League Division Series Game 5.
The Guardians decided to go back to Boyd, despite having multiple options, as they believe he is the right answer to pitch in an elimination game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is a do-or-die situation for the Guardians, who are desperate to make another October run and end their 77-year World Series drought.
Matthew Boyd is emotional about the opportunity to pitch in this game, as it's an accomplishment to be trusted by a team in a do-or-die situation when he was unsigned just four months ago.
Others: The game will be played in front of a sellout crowd at Progressive Field.
The Guardians will likely use a bullpen game, with multiple relievers pitching, including Cade Smith, Hunter Gaddis, Tim Herrin, and Emmanuel Clase.
